data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_PasswordAdmin_Description
data.value: Password to protect admin access via "#login <PASSWORD>".

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_Password_Description
data.value: Password for the connection to the server.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_ServerCommandPassword_Description
data.value: Password required for the alternative syntax of serverCommand's server-side scripting (case-sensitive).

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_Hostname_Description
data.value: Server name visible in the game browser.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MaxPlayers_Description
data.value: The maximum number of players that can connect to the server. The final number is the smaller value between the number given here and the number of mission slots.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_Motd_Description
data.value: Message displayed when connecting to the server.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_Admins_Description
data.value: List of player uids (SteamID64) that are able to #login without providing a password. Format: {"1234567890", "2345678901"}

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_LocalClient_Description
data.value: Declares clients with unlimited bandwidth and almost no latency.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_FilePatchingExceptions_Description
data.value: List of player Uids (SteamId64) that are allowed to ignore the rules of allowedFilePatching and verifySignatures so they can join the server with any mods of their choice. Signature errors are still logged by the server on connection and can kick the user if the error occurs before the server knows the client's SteamID, e.g. if they try to join with completely unsigned pbo's.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_HeadlessClients_Description
data.value: Headless Client IPs. Im Falle mehrerer Headless Clients sind mehrere Verbindungen und Adressen zulässig.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_VoteThreshold_Description
data.value: Percentage of votes needed to confirm a vote.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_VoteMissionPlayers_Description
data.value: Required number of players for the start of the mission selection

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AllowedVoteCmdsArray_Description
data.value: allowedVoteCmds[] = {{<commandName>, <preMissionStart>, <postMissionStart>, <votingThreshold>}, ...};, where: <commandName>: string - name of the command, for example "admin". <preMissionStart> (Optional): Boolean value - true to allow the command before the mission start. Default: true <postMissionStart> (Optional): Boolean value - true to allow the command after the mission start. Default: true <votingThreshold> (Optional): Number - voting threshold 0...1. Default: value assigned to voteThreshold parameter. Otherwise 0.5 <percentSideVotingThreshold> (Optional): Number - Percentage side threshold 0...1. Default: 0.5 (since Arma 3 1.90+ PerformaceBranch).

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AllowedVotedAdminCmdsArray_Description
data.value: allowedVoteAdminCmds[] = {{<commandName>, <preMissionStart>}, ...};, where: <commandName>: string - name of the command, for example "admin". <preMissionStart> (Optional): Boolean value - true to allow the command before the mission start. Default: true <postMissionStart> (Optional): Boolean value - true to allow the command after the mission start. Default: true If no command is specified ( allowedVotedAdminCmds[] = {}; ), it means that such commands are disabled for the selected administrator. No specification of allowedVotedAdminCmds means that everything is allowed for the selected admin at all times!

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_Kickduplicate_Description
data.value: If this option is enabled, duplicate player IDs will not be allowed. The second player with an existing ID will be kicked automatically.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_Loopback_Description
data.value: When this option is enabled, the server is set to LAN mode. This allows multiple local instances of the game to connect to the server for testing purposes. At the same time, all non-local instances are prevented from connecting.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_Upnp_Description
data.value:
Creates an automatic port mapping on a UPNP/IGD enabled router, if enabled. This option allows you to create a server behind NAT (the router must have a public IP and support UPNP/IGD protocol).
If this setting is enabled, the server startup may be delayed by 600 seconds (default UDP timeout of 10 minutes) if it is blocked by a firewall, bad routing, etc. Therefore, it is recommended to disable this setting in such cases.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AllowedFilePatching_Description
data.value: Prevent or allow file changes at runtime for the clients (including HC).

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_Host_Port_Description
data.value: Port on which the dedicated server should listen.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_Host_ServerMod_Description
data.value: Loads the specified subfolders for various server-side (not transferred to clients) mods. Separated by semicolons. Absolute path and multiple stacked folders are possible. In Linux, arguments for multiple folders require the following separator syntax: -mod=mod1\;mod2\;mod3.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MaxMsgSend_Description
data.value: Maximum number of packets (grouped messages) that can be sent in one simulation cycle ("frame"). Increasing this value can reduce the delay on servers with high upload bandwidth.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MaxSizeGuaranteed_Description
data.value: Maximum size (payload) of the guaranteed packet in bytes (without header). Small messages are packed into larger packets (aggregate messages). Guaranteed packets (aggregate messages) are used for non-recurring events like firing.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MaxSizeNonguaranteed_Description
data.value: Maximum size (payload) of the non-guaranteed packet in bytes (without header). Small messages are packed into larger packets (aggregate messages). Non-guaranteed packets (aggregate messages) are used for repetitive updates such as the position of soldiers or vehicles. Increasing this value can improve the bandwidth requirement, but may increase the delay.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MinBandwidth_Description
data.value: Bandwidth guaranteed to the server (in bps). This value helps the server estimate the available bandwidth. An overly optimistic value can increase delay and CPU load because too many messages are sent but discarded.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MaxBandwidth_Description
data.value: Bandwidth that is guaranteed never to be available to the server (in bps). This value helps the server estimate the available bandwidth.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MinErrorToSend_Description
data.value: Minimal bug when sending updates over the network. Using a smaller value can cause units observed with binoculars or sniper rifles to move more smoothly, but this comes with increased network traffic. Example: A unit 1 km (distance d = 1 km) from the player with MinErrorToSend = 0.001 (METS = 0.001) would send an update if that unit moved 50 m (error value E = 50). Formula: d = sqrt[(20E)/METS] ; 1000 = sqrt[(20E)/0.001] -> E = 50 In reality, other factors of the object are also considered according to a weighted scale. If the error value (E) between the master copy of an object (whoever "owns" the object) and the perceived/simulated copy of the same object by a client is >= MinErrorToSend (METS), a network update message is sent for that object.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MinErrorToSendNear_Description
data.value: Minimal error when sending updates over the network for nearby units. Using a larger value may reduce traffic for nearby units. Also used to control traffic between client and server. Using MinErrorToSend alone, for small distance values (d), the frequency of high errors (E) would result in excessive network messages that are not necessary but could negatively affect FPS. Too large a value for METSN may prevent desirable network update messages from being sent in a timely manner, causing units to appear to "warp".

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_MaxCustomFileSize_Description
data.value: Users with a custom face or custom tone larger than this size will be rejected when attempting to connect.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_SocketsMaxPacketSize_Description
data.value: Maximum size of the packet sent over the network. This can be set independently for both client-to-server and server-to-client(s)! !!! Only use if your router or ISP enforces a smaller packet size and you have connection problems with the game. Desync could happen if MaxSizeGuaranteed/MaxSizeNonuaranteed values above maxPacketSize are used.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_Host_Mod_Description
data.value: Loads the specified subfolders for different mods. Separated by semicolons. Absolute path and multiple stacked folders are possible. In Linux, arguments for multiple folders require the following separation syntax: mod1\;mod2\;modn. The "relative path" starts with the directory from which the Arma 3 executable was launched, and is not always the same as where the executable is located, as in betas. Usually this is the same as the installation path and the same as the one entered in the Windows registry. However, if you copy or symlink the necessary files and folders, you can have different roots. This is useful if you have multiple dedicated servers.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AllowedFilePatching_Value0_Description
data.value: Disabled for both headless clients and normal clients

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AllowedFilePatching_Value1_Description
data.value: Allowed for headless client, disabled for normal clients

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AllowedFilePatching_Value2_Description
data.value: Allowed for both headless clients and normal clients

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_SteamProtocolMaxSize_Description
data.value: Limit value for the maximum length of Steam Query packets. Increasing this value is dangerous, as it can cause the Arma 3 server to send UDP packets that are larger than the MTU. This causes UDP packets to be fragmented, which is not supported by some older routers. However, increasing this value fixes the length limitation of the modlists in Arma 3: Launcher.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_GameFolders_MPMissions_Description
data.value: The folder in which the missions are to be stored.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_Host_HeadlessClientIp_Description
data.value: The ip address to connect the headless client to.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_Host_HeadlessClientPassword_Description
data.value: The password of the server to connect the client to.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AdvancedOptionsLogObjectNotFound_Description
data.value: If set, "Server: Object not found" messages are logged

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AdvancedOptionsSkipDescriptionParsing_Description
data.value: Set to skip parsing description.ext/mission.sqm. Shows the pbo filename instead of the configured mission name. OverviewText and similar will not work, but loading the mission list is much faster when there are many missions

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AdvancedOptionsIgnoreMissionLoadErrors_Description
data.value: If set to , the mission is loaded regardless of the number of load errors. If not set, the server will abort loading the mission and return to the mission selection.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_AdvancedOptionsQueueSizeLogG_Description
data.value: If #monitor is running and the size of a player's guaranteed message queue (listed as G: in #monitor) exceeds the threshold, all message types and sizes of that player are written to a log file in the RPT directory (see Crash Files); the writing itself is logged server-side.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_BattlEye_Description
data.value: Enables or disables the BattlEye anti-cheat engine. Requires BattlEye to be installed on the server and clients joining the server.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_Persistent_Description
data.value: Mission continues when all clients disconnect. If you enable the Persistence option, missions with base or instant respawn continue to run after all players disconnect. The other respawn types do not make a mission persistent. The type of respawn that a particular mission uses is specified in its Description.ext.

data.name: DiscordCommand_TeamSpeak_NotConfigured
data.value: No TeamSpeak has been set up.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_BattlEyeCfg_Rcon_RconPort_Description
data.value: The port which accepts rcon connections.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_BattlEyeCfg_Rcon_RconPassword_Description
data.value: The password for access to rcon.

data.name: ServerController_Arma3_ServerCfg_ForcedDifficulty_Description
data.value: Forces the selected difficulty on the server. forcedDifficulty = "<difficultyClass>"; - If Recruit, Regular, or Veteran is passed as a parameter, the respective difficulty options are taken from the data configuration, CfgDifficultyPresets class. - If Custom is passed as a parameter, the individual flags from the CustomDifficulty class are taken from the server profile (only Custom is stored in the profile). - If a mission cycle is defined in server.cfg, the difficulty set in the mission cycle overrides the difficulty set by the forcedDifficulty parameter.
